topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552f46956368722bcab40900#post_552f46956368722bcab40900
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552f462e6368725a0c540800#post_552f462e6368725a0c540800
more complex and more assured profit so less necessary to patch.
Basically the same motivations that lead to shoddiness in general[/bq]
I remember something along this line.

I forget what game it was but basically this programmer at the last second before the game his company was working on found a glitch that if you saved during a boss battle it would format your entire computer and brought it up to his boss.  Later on he was fired.

topics.body: Call me crazy, but in ten years time I really hope games are exclusively bought digitally cause a lot of these problems pop up because crappy companies have the mentality of "well it's too late in production to fix this problem that bricks the console/computer; better push it into publication anyhow".  In say ten years time when internet connections stop being so crappy it might be feasible to go digital only cause if a glitch that bricks the machine is found out at the last second they can just change the data; physical discs on the other hand if it's found out too late then it's "too late to fix".
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552f4df46368722bca871300#post_552f4df46368722bca871300
Usually whenever I have an extra day off of work, I'll go for a long walk
I always speed walk, because legitimately because if I walk slowly, I feel uncomfortable, but sometimes when I'm listening to my music, I feel like speeding up and jogging, but then I don't because I think it will be too hard on me

Like, I need to stop thinking like that and just push myself, even if it hurts
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a
